step1.sentence: Before signing the contract, the lawyer urged everyone to dive into the details and flag any unclear clauses.

step2.story: The project manager handed out the fifty-page report and told the team to dive into the details before the afternoon meeting. Most people groaned, but Sara highlighted every clause and arrived with a page of questions. Her thoroughness caught a budget error that would have cost thousands.

step3.story: When Marcus joined the startup as lead engineer, the codebase looked clean from the outside. His first instinct was to dive into the details — reading every module, tracing every data flow, and mapping out hidden dependencies others had ignored. Late nights became routine as sticky notes covered his monitor with discoveries ranging from minor quirks to critical security gaps. Colleagues teased him for being obsessive, but when the product launched without a single major bug, they understood. The difference between a smooth release and a disaster had been his willingness to go deep where others had skimmed the surface.

meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 주제나 문서, 문제를 표면적으로 넘기지 않고 깊고 꼼꼼하게 살펴보는 행동을 나타낼 때 쓴다. 회의, 계약 검토, 분석 작업 등 전문적 맥락에서 자주 등장한다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'dive'는 물속으로 뛰어드는 동작에서 유래해 '깊이 파고들다'는 비유적 의미로 확장됐고, 'into details'와 결합해 세밀한 분석을 뜻하는 표현이 됐다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 읽는 것보다 더 적극적이고 철저한 검토를 암시하며, 긍정적으로는 성실함과 전문성을, 부정적 문맥에서는 과도한 집착처럼 들릴 수도 있다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Let's not dive into the details right now — we can save that for the follow-up session.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 지금 당장 세부 사항까지 파고들 필요는 없어요 — 후속 세션에서 다루면 됩니다.
